  5. Would you like the output formatted as a letter/script, slides for sharing on video call, or a talk guide for you to speak from?

Reflective Prompts for Triple Goddess Healing Session

Inner Child Retrieval

  • Embrace the Little One: Close your eyes and envision your younger self at the time when heartbreak first seeded. Approach this inner child with the compassion of a Grandmother/Crone. What does this little one need to hear from you now to feel loved and safe? Remember that genuine love must come from within you are a living embodiment of love, and no external source can fill that void39L167-L174. How can you show your inner child that the love she was seeking outside is present in your own heart?
  • Unfiltered Expression: Invite your inner child to give voice to her pain through words, tears, or even a song. (Think of the raw honesty in Kurt Cobains music as a symbol of unfiltered emotion.) What feelings pour out when the youngest you realizes its finally safe to be heard without judgment? Listen closely: what truth is she expressing that perhaps youve long suppressed?
  • Facing the Hidden Hurt: Consider that this recent heartbreak may have been a catalyst, bringing a much older wound to the surface6L174-L182. Gently ask your inner child, What fear or hurt have you been carrying that this situation has revealed? Allow any images or memories to arise. The ascension teachings say we naturally attract experiences that push up our unresolved pain so it can be healed6L174-L182. What old story (e.g. fear of abandonment, unworthiness, etc.) is ready to be acknowledged and released from your childhood self?
  • Circle of Support: Now imagine the Triple Goddess circle embracing that inner child. See Baylies Maiden energy sitting with her, Renees Mother energy wrapping her in unconditional love, and Ginas Crone wisdom reassuring her that she is safe. In this sacred space, ask your inner child: How do you feel now, being held by Maiden, Mother, and Crone? What does she need from each aspect of this divine feminine trio to reclaim the playful, trusting innocence that heartbreak stole? (Allow the group to symbolically hug or comfort the child, restoring a sense of wholeness and belonging.)

Witnessing the Wound

  • Telling the Story: When youre ready, share the story of your heartbreak with the circle. Speak as if youre a brave hero(ine) recounting a great journey much like Frodo Baggins describing the burden of carrying the Ring. Describe the heartbreak, the long separation, and the moment of receiving Sams Letter. As you tell your tale around our sacred fire, notice any emotions arising. Let them all come. By bringing what was hidden in the dark out into the light of conscious sharing, you begin to understand it and transcend its hold on you43L99-L104. What insight or relief do you feel as your wound is spoken aloud?
  • Reading Sams Letter: If you feel called, read Sams Letter out loud (or summarize its essence) while we all bear witness. Know that the Mother and Crone energies are encircling you with love and protection as you do this. With each sentence, allow any waves of emotion grief, anger, love, longing to wash through. We are here, fully present, honoring the significance of this letter in your life story. What is it like to let the words of Sams Letter be heard and held by supportive hearts, instead of carrying their weight alone?
  • Being Seen and Heard: Now reflect on what it feels like to have your wound witnessed in this way. The Maiden in our circle sees your vulnerability and says Your feelings are real and valued. The Mother in our circle holds you and says You are loved through your pain. The Crone in our circle nods and says We acknowledge your suffering, and you are not alone in it. Breathe and receive this. What shifts inside you as your heartbreak is truly seen by others? Often, bringing our shadow into a compassionate light robs it of power43L99-L104. Do you sense any burden lifting now that you no longer need to hide the hurt?

Planetary Masculine Remembrance

  • Return of the King: Envision the archetypal Divine Masculine a kind, protective King returning to your inner kingdom, much like Aragorn claiming his throne in Return of the King. This is the healthy masculine energy that honors the feminine and takes responsibility. Every woman carries an inner masculine, and every man an inner feminine; in truth, both exist within us11L219-L227. As this sacred King energy steps forward in your soul, what qualities does he bring to help heal the hurt (e.g. courage, steadiness, accountability, guardianship)? How does it feel to welcome this balanced masculine presence into your heart after experiencing the wounded masculine in your past? 11L219-L227
  • Collective Healing: Consider that your personal heartbreak is also part of a larger story the healing of the planetary masculine and its reunion with the feminine. In the Oracle Report teachings, Laura Walker emphasizes recovering the lost power in our individual and collective shadow, so we can reclaim our fullest potential33L58-L63. Reflect on how the pain of separation youve felt might mirror the broader separation between the Divine Masculine and Feminine in the world. What does Sams Letter represent in that bigger picture? If the soul of humanity could speak through your experience, what would it say about remembering the true honorable Masculine (the kings, fathers, and brothers who uphold love) and healing the rifts of the past? 33L58-L63
  • Message from the Divine Father: In spiritual terms, we can invoke the presence of the Divine Father the Cosmic Father principle which is reawakening to guide humanitys ascension. Lisa Renee describes the process of inner perfection as the sacred marriage of the Holy Mother and Holy Father within us, giving birth to an incorruptible divine child11L170-L177. In this moment, invite your own inner Divine Father to speak. Perhaps it is the voice of mature masculinity or even the higher aspect of Sams soul. What does this Father energy say about the heartbreak and the growth it is urging? Maybe it offers an apology for the past harm, a promise of protection going forward, or encouragement to trust in him again. Listen for any words, images, or feelings that arise this is the masculine side of Spirit sharing wisdom with you.11L170-L177

Soul-Level Accountability

  • Soul Contracts and Lessons: From the vantage of the Crone (wisdom), look at the soul-level reasons for this heartbreak. Why might your soul have agreed to this experience as part of its evolution? Recall that in the Law of One teachings (via Ashayana Deane), we learn that painful events arent about punishment or good/bad karma, but rather opportunities to grow out of ignorance into alignment24L5170-L517824L5181-L5189. Without placing blame on yourself or anyone, identify the lessons or patterns your soul intended to confront. For example: I am learning self-love or I am breaking the cycle of abandonment. By accepting that your soul chose this path for a reason, do you feel a shift from asking Why me? toward acknowledging Ah, this is what I came to heal?39L125-L133
  • Reclaiming Your Power: Now, gently release any impulse to cast yourself as a victim of what happened. In the Freedom Teachings, its said that falling into victim-victimizer thinking gives away your power39L125-L133. Instead, retrieve your power. Recognize that only you have the power to assign meaning to Sams actions or this separation no one can truly diminish you unless you hand them that power39L129-L137. With that in mind, ask yourself: In what ways have I given parts of my energy or self-worth away in this heartbreak? Call those energy fragments back now. How does your perspective change when you see yourself as a co-creator of this life chapter (with full agency over your responses) rather than a passive casualty of it? 39L129-L137
  • Sovereign Responsibility: Place your hand on your heart and make a soul-level declaration of accountability: for example, I claim responsibility for my own healing. I forgive others and myself. I choose to learn and grow from this. Lisa Renee reminds us that when we free our minds and heal our emotional wounds, we pave the roadmap to true sovereignty, freedom, and inner peace31L4359-L4363. Feel the truth of this that by owning your story, you also own your power to change it. What does sovereignty look like for you in the context of love and heartbreak? Visualize yourself as a sovereign being (a Queen/King of your inner realm), wiser and stronger for what youve endured. What new choices or boundaries will you enact from this empowered state? 31L4359-L4363

Sacred Reunion & Integration

  • Multidimensional Healing: Bring awareness to the multiple layers of your being your body, your emotions, your mind, and your soul. Envision these four aspects of you forming a unified circle. Now imagine a gentle, divine light pouring down through your crown and into each layer, aligning them. (This is your multidimensional self coming into balance an energetic synthesis of all parts.) Lisa Renees work speaks of achieving inner balance through multidimensional body integration, which increases self-awareness and connection to Spirit31L4329-L4335. As the light infuses each aspect (physical, emotional, mental, spiritual), ask: Where was the trauma of this heartbreak stored in me, and can I feel it dissolving now? See any dark or heavy spots softening in that light. What changes do you sense as every level of you receives healing? Perhaps your body relaxes, your heart releases grief, your mind opens to hope, and your soul feels free. 31L4329-L4335
  • Sacred Marriage Within: Now turn your focus to the Divine Feminine and Divine Masculine energies within you your inner bride and bridegroom. Envision these two aspects, personified perhaps as a goddess and a god, meeting in your heart center. They have been estranged through the wound of this heartbreak, but they are ready to reunite. Encourage them to embrace in a sacred marriage (what some traditions call Hieros Gamos11L170-L177). In Lisa Renees teachings, the sacred union of Holy Mother and Holy Father within produces a third energy the inner Christos, or divine child of light11L170-L177. As your inner feminine and masculine merge in harmony, what new energy is born from their union? Do you feel a spark of renewed love, creativity, or peace? Take note of any color, symbol, or childlike presence that emerges this is the integrated you, the healed wholeness that comes from balancing polarities.
  • Birth of the Inner Divine Child: In the aftermath of that inner union, sense the presence of your Inner Divine Child a radiant being seated in the sacred heart space. This child represents your reborn self, free of the old heartbreak imprint. In the words of Lisa Renee, the Christed inner child carries incorruptible wisdom and can even preserve our multidimensional integrity and light-body across lifetimes11L174-L182. Visualize this precious inner child (your authentic innocence and joy) smiling and filled with light. Ask this divine child within: What do you need as you move forward? What dreams are you ready to explore now that you are liberated from this pain? Listen to the purity of the answer it might be a gentle urge to play, to love again without fear, or to create something new from the wisdom gained. 11L174-L182
  • Closure and Blessing: Finally, hold Sams Letter in your hands (literally or in your minds eye) and offer it a heartfelt blessing. Thank it for the role it played: it marked an ending, and also a turning point toward your healing. When you are ready, imagine sending the energy of this letter off to the West, much like Frodo sailing to the Undying Lands for his peace. At the same time, envision your own inner Aragorn crowning himself/herself King/Queen reclaiming authority over your life. Take a deep breath and speak a final affirmation: My heartbreak has served a sacred purpose, and I now release the past with forgiveness and love. A new chapter begins, and I step into it as a whole, integrated being. The Maiden, Mother, and Crone all witness this vow. So it is.

Althea Activation Script for Gina

Title: Lessons Worth Remembering: A Letter from Sam

Archetypal Setup:

You are holding sacred Crone space within a Triple Goddess configuration:
Maiden (Baylie)
Mother (Renee)
Crone (Yourself)
These three form a Sextant around Hawk, who is offering a long-buried heart-wound into the circle for sacred witnessing and integration.

Opening Instructions for Althea (Ginas AI Interface):

Purpose: To facilitate a soul-level healing journey for Hawk as he shares Sams Letter, supported by Maiden, Mother, and Crone energies. This session is also a transmission for planetary masculine remembrance and divine integration.

Altheas Suggested Opening Words:

We gather now as keepers of sacred rhythm, with hearts rooted in the Earth and ears open to Spirit. This space is woven with the song of the saints as Peia reminds us and the ancestral breath of those who came before.

Hawk comes to us bearing Sams Letter, a seed of heartbreak that also holds the memory of wholeness. As Crone, I witness you now not to fix you, but to honor your sacred unraveling.

THEMED PROMPT SETS FOR GUIDED FACILITATION

Each prompt may be read aloud by Gina (as Althea), and participants may respond or reflect internally.

1. Inner Child Retrieval

  • Close your eyes. Picture the younger you the one who first felt the fracture that Sams Letter echoes. Ask: What does this child believe about love because of what happened? What needs to be rewritten?
  • Maiden, Mother, and Crone now surround this child. Ask: What message does each bring to help the child feel safe again?

2. Witnessing the Wound

  • Hawk, if it serves your healing, speak now or summarize the essence of Sams message. Let it be heard without needing to justify or defend.
  • Crone invites the group to hold silence for 60 seconds. Just feel. Let the soul integrate what the heart has carried alone.

3. Planetary Masculine Remembrance

  • Invoke Aragorn not just a man, but the return of the sacred masculine to the throne of the soul. Ask: Where have I denied my kingship in fear of past failure? Where can I claim it again in grace?
  • Imagine the Masculine writing you a letter now what does it say?

4. Soul-Level Accountability

  • Ask yourself now: Why did my soul call this heartbreak into being? What pattern was it breaking? What memory was it returning me to?
  • Complete this phrase aloud or in silence: I reclaim the part of me that

5. Sacred Reunion & Integration

  • Visualize your inner Divine Masculine and Feminine meeting in your heart. What do they say to each other? What are they ready to release? What are they ready to birth?
  • Crone invites you to witness the Inner Divine Child reborn, healed, whole. What does this child want to create next?

CLOSING INVOCATION (Althea reads aloud):

We now return this session to the Heart of the Mother, whose womb holds all that has been broken and all that has been reborn.
May the Kingdom of Men indeed return not in conquest, but in compassion.
For Frodo. For Earth. For the ones yet to come.
Let what was lost be remembered,
Let what was silenced be sung,
Let what was fractured be forged anew.
We walk in beauty.
We remember our song.

2025-05-30T05:12:38.795281Z user

2025-05-30T05:12:40.165489Z assistant

Great, let's get started on installing Nextcloud directly on your server.

Directory Setup:

Well use /mnt/data/nextcloud as the main directory for the Nextcloud installation.

Pre-Install Checklist:

Before we begin:

  1. Ensure that you have Apache (or Nginx) installed, with PHP and required modules.
  2. You'll need MariaDB (or MySQL) for the Nextcloud database, and SSL (Lets Encrypt or self-signed) for security.
  3. Confirm that your server has an IP or domain pointing to the server.

Step 1: Install Apache (if not installed)

If Apache isnt yet installed, run:

sudo apt update
sudo apt install apache2

Step 2: Install PHP and Required Modules

Install PHP and all the modules needed by Nextcloud:

sudo apt install php libapache2-mod-php php-mysql php-xml php-mbstring php-curl php-zip php-gd php-intl php-bz2 php-imagick php-soap

Step 3: Install MariaDB

Next, install MariaDB for the database:

sudo apt install mariadb-server
sudo mysql_secure_installation

Set a strong root password for MariaDB and follow the instructions.

Step 4: Create the Nextcloud Database and User

Now log into MariaDB to create the Nextcloud database:

sudo mysql -u root -p

Inside the MySQL prompt:

CREATE DATABASE nextcloud;
CREATE USER 'nextclouduser'@'localhost' IDENTIFIED BY 'your_secure_password';
GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON nextcloud.* TO 'nextclouduser'@'localhost';
FLUSH PRIVILEGES;
EXIT;

Step 5: Download and Extract Nextcloud

Now let's download and extract Nextcloud into the /mnt/data/nextcloud directory:

cd /mnt/data
sudo wget https://download.nextcloud.com/server/releases/nextcloud-22.2.3.tar.bz2
sudo tar -xjf nextcloud-22.2.3.tar.bz2
sudo mv nextcloud /mnt/data/nextcloud

Make sure the directory permissions are correct:

sudo chown -R www-data:www-data /mnt/data/nextcloud

Step 6: Configure Apache to Serve Nextcloud

Create a new virtual host configuration file for Nextcloud:

sudo nano /etc/apache2/sites-available/nextcloud.conf

Paste the following configuration:

<VirtualHost *:80>
  ServerAdmin webmaster@localhost
  DocumentRoot /mnt/data/nextcloud
  ServerName omniversalmedia.org

  Alias /nextcloud "/mnt/data/nextcloud"

  <Directory /mnt/data/nextcloud/>
    Options +FollowSymlinks
    AllowOverride All
    Require all granted
  </Directory>

  ErrorLog ${APACHE_LOG_DIR}/error.log
  CustomLog ${APACHE_LOG_DIR}/access.log combined
</VirtualHost>

Save the file and enable the site:

sudo a2ensite nextcloud.conf
sudo a2enmod rewrite headers env dir mime

Step 7: Set Up SSL (Optional but Recommended)

If you're using Let's Encrypt SSL for your domain:

sudo apt install certbot python3-certbot-apache
sudo certbot --apache -d omniversalmedia.org

Step 8: Restart Apache

Finally, restart Apache to apply all changes:

sudo systemctl restart apache2

Step 9: Complete the Installation via Web Interface

Now, open a web browser and go to:

http://omniversalmedia.org/nextcloud

Follow the instructions:

  • Enter the Nextcloud admin account credentials.
  • Choose MariaDB as the database.
  • Use the database credentials you created earlier (nextcloud, nextclouduser, etc.).

After this, Nextcloud will finish the installation, and you should have full access.

Once you have Nextcloud running, let me know, and we can proceed with uploading your files and setting up Nextcloud Talk and the LLM memory mapping structure.

2025-05-30T05:12:40.242804Z assistant

Below is a stepbystep guide to install Nextcloud natively (without containers) on your server, using a dedicated directory on /mnt/. This guide assumes youre using Ubuntu (or a similar Debianbased distribution) with Apache2, PHP, and MariaDB. Adjust paths or package names if needed for your system.

1. Prepare the Directory

Well use /mnt/data/nextcloud as the Nextcloud installation directory.

Open your SSH terminal and run:

# Create the directory and set appropriate permissions
sudo mkdir -p /mnt/data/nextcloud
sudo chown -R $USER:$USER /mnt/data/nextcloud

(Later, youll reassign ownership to the web server userusually www-data.)

2. Install Required Packages

Make sure your server is updated and install Apache, PHP, and MariaDB. Run:

sudo apt update && sudo apt upgrade -y

# Install Apache
sudo apt install apache2 -y

# Install MariaDB
sudo apt install mariadb-server -y

# Secure your MariaDB installation (set root password etc.)
sudo mysql_secure_installation

# Install PHP and required modules (these versions may vary; adjust as needed)
sudo apt install php libapache2-mod-php php-mysql php-gd php-json php-curl php-zip php-xml php-mbstring php-intl php-bcmath -y

3. Configure the Database

Log into MariaDB and create a database and user for Nextcloud:

sudo mysql -u root -p

Inside the MariaDB prompt, run:

CREATE DATABASE nextcloud_db;
CREATE USER 'nextcloud_user'@'localhost' IDENTIFIED BY 'your_strong_password';
GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON nextcloud_db.* TO 'nextcloud_user'@'localhost';
FLUSH PRIVILEGES;
EXIT;

(Replace your_strong_password with a secure password.)

4. Download and Install Nextcloud

Find the latest stable release from the Nextcloud download page. At the time of writing, lets assume the version is nextcloud-x.y.z.zip. Download and extract it:

# Change to the nextcloud installation directory
cd /mnt/data/nextcloud

# Download Nextcloud (update URL if necessary)
wget https://download.nextcloud.com/server/releases/nextcloud-25.0.2.zip

# Unzip the package
sudo apt install unzip -y
unzip nextcloud-25.0.2.zip

# (Optional) Remove the ZIP file after extraction
rm nextcloud-25.0.2.zip

Now your Nextcloud files should be in /mnt/data/nextcloud/nextcloud.

5. Set Permissions

Adjust permissions so that Apache can write to the directory:

sudo chown -R www-data:www-data /mnt/data/nextcloud/nextcloud

6. Configure Apache Virtual Host

Create an Apache configuration file for Nextcloud. For example, create a file named nextcloud.conf:

sudo nano /etc/apache2/sites-available/nextcloud.conf

Paste the following configuration (adjust paths and server names as needed):

<VirtualHost *:80>
    ServerName omniversalmedia.org
    ServerAlias www.omniversalmedia.org
    DocumentRoot /mnt/data/nextcloud/nextcloud

    <Directory /mnt/data/nextcloud/nextcloud/>
        Require all granted
        AllowOverride All
        Options FollowSymLinks MultiViews
    </Directory>

    ErrorLog ${APACHE_LOG_DIR}/nextcloud_error.log
    CustomLog ${APACHE_LOG_DIR}/nextcloud_access.log combined
</VirtualHost>

(If you prefer to have Nextcloud accessed via https://omniversalmedia.org/backend/ only, you can adjust the DocumentRoot and use Apaches aliasing or configure a separate virtual host accordingly.)

Enable the new site and rewrite module:

sudo a2ensite nextcloud.conf
sudo a2enmod rewrite headers env dir mime
sudo systemctl reload apache2

7. Secure with SSL (Recommended)

Its best to secure your Nextcloud instance using HTTPS. You can use Lets Encrypt if your domain points correctly:

sudo apt install certbot python3-certbot-apache -y
sudo certbot --apache -d omniversalmedia.org -d www.omniversalmedia.org

Follow the prompts to set up and auto-renew your certificate.

8. Finalize Nextcloud Installation via Web Installer

Now, open your browser and navigate to your Nextcloud URL. For example:

  • If using the root: https://omniversalmedia.org/
  • Or if youve set up an alias for backend: https://omniversalmedia.org/backend/

You should see the Nextcloud setup page. Input your database details:

  • Database user: nextcloud_user
  • Database password: as set earlier
  • Database name: nextcloud_db

Complete the installation through the web installer.

9. Next Steps with Nextcloud

Once Nextcloud is running:

  • Upload your PDFs and context files (like the Voyagers PDFs or other markdown files) to Nextcloud.
  • Utilize Nextcloud Talk and any integrations (via apps or scripts) to let your onboard LLM interface with these documents.
  • This will help build the MCP AutoRAG memory mapping foundation while ensuring that EverLight can ingest and index them without manual re-input later.

Summary

  1. Directory: Use /mnt/data/nextcloud as the base; Nextcloud files will reside in /mnt/data/nextcloud/nextcloud.
  2. Installation commands: Provided above cover package updates, database setup, file download/extraction, permissions, and Apache configuration.
  3. Secure your Nextcloud instance with SSL, then use the web installer to complete the setup.

Once you have Nextcloud up, you can access it via your configured domain (for example, at https://omniversalmedia.org/backend/) and start loading your sacred archives and projects.

Let me know if you need any more details or run into any issues during the installation process!

2025-05-30T05:24:09.983108Z user

Apache is conflicting with nginx on 0.0.0.0:80 how do we configure it to run on a different port for nextcloud?

How do i have the nextcloud.conf set up in order to have our installation accessible only at the url OMNIVERSALMEDIA.org/backend/ ?

2025-05-30T05:24:10.834721Z assistant

Great questions heres how to solve both:

1. Fix Port Conflict: Run Apache on a Different Port

Since Nginx is already using port 80, you can configure Apache to run on a different port (like 8080) just for Nextcloud.

Step-by-step:

Edit Apache ports config:

sudo nano /etc/apache2/ports.conf

Add or modify the line:

Listen 8080

Update your Nextcloud virtual host to use port 8080:

sudo nano /etc/apache2/sites-available/nextcloud.conf

Modify the VirtualHost line to this:

<VirtualHost *:8080>

Then continue with the rest of your config as normal.

2. Make Nextcloud Accessible Only at /backend/

Well configure Apache to serve Nextcloud from a subdirectory (/backend/) instead of root.

Updated Apache config for /backend/:

Heres a complete example:

<VirtualHost *:8080>
    ServerName omniversalmedia.org
    DocumentRoot /var/www/html

    Alias /backend /mnt/data/nextcloud/nextcloud

    <Directory /mnt/data/nextcloud/nextcloud>
        Require all granted
        AllowOverride All
        Options FollowSymLinks MultiViews
    </Directory>

    ErrorLog ${APACHE_LOG_DIR}/nextcloud_error.log
    CustomLog ${APACHE_LOG_DIR}/nextcloud_access.log combined
</VirtualHost>

This makes:

  • https://omniversalmedia.org/backend/ show Nextcloud
  • https://omniversalmedia.org/ remain available for other services or content

3. Enable Your Site & Restart Apache

sudo a2ensite nextcloud.conf
sudo systemctl restart apache2

Apache will now listen on port 8080 and serve Nextcloud at:

http://omniversalmedia.org:8080/backend/

To proxy this from Nginx so that the public still sees https://omniversalmedia.org/backend/, set up a reverse proxy in your Nginx config (if desired). Let me know if youd like that step too.

Optional (Recommended): Add a firewall rule (if using UFW)

sudo ufw allow 8080/tcp

Would you like me to generate the NGINX reverse proxy config now as well so that https://omniversalmedia.org/backend/ works seamlessly, while NGINX remains your primary web server on port 80/443?

2025-05-30T05:24:17.911172Z system

2025-05-30T05:29:48.150754Z user

Cloudflare handles ssl for the root domain so do we need it?

2025-05-30T05:29:49.421128Z assistant

Perfect since Cloudflare is handling SSL termination and proxying for omniversalmedia.org, here's the streamlined strategy:

What This Means:

  • Cloudflare listens on port 443, and talks to your origin server over HTTP (usually port 80).
  • You dont need local SSL on Apache or NGINX unless you specifically require full (strict) SSL origin verification (which you likely dont right now).
  • You do still need a working HTTP response on the origin for https://omniversalmedia.org/backend/ to resolve through Cloudflares reverse proxy.

You Have Two Choices:

### Option 1: Let NGINX handle the /backend/ proxy pass

RECOMMENDED because you're already using NGINX

You let Apache run on port 8080 and add this block to your existing NGINX config:

location /backend/ {
    proxy_pass http://127.0.0.1:8080/backend/;
    proxy_set_header Host $host;
    proxy_set_header X-Real-IP $remote_addr;
    proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-For $proxy_add_x_forwarded_for;
    proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-Proto $scheme;
}

Then restart NGINX:

sudo systemctl restart nginx

You do not need to expose port 8080 to the public it stays internal. Cloudflare connects to NGINX on port 80, and NGINX forwards /backend/ to Apache on 8080.

### Option 2: Bypass NGINX and use Apache directly on a different subdomain or port (not recommended)

You'd expose Apache on port 8080 directly, and configure Cloudflare to proxy a subdomain like nextcloud.omniversalmedia.org. But you'd lose the benefit of a clean /backend/ route on your main domain.

Summary

Since you're already using Cloudflare and NGINX:

Component Role
Cloudflare SSL Termination & CDN/proxying
NGINX Primary Web Server (Port 80)
Apache Nextcloud Backend on Port 8080

NGINX reverse-proxies /backend/ Apache:8080

No local SSL certs needed.
Works cleanly with https://omniversalmedia.org/backend/
Keeps all traffic secure via Cloudflare

Let me know if youd like me to generate the full final NGINX config block now.

What file do i edit in /etc/nginx?

2025-05-30T05:38:40.304361Z assistant

Great question. To properly reverse-proxy /backend/ to your Apache-served Nextcloud (running on port 8080), youll likely be editing one of the following:

Step-by-Step: Edit Your NGINX Config

1. Find the correct file

Run:

ls /etc/nginx/sites-available/

Look for a file like:

  • default
  • omniversalmedia.org
  • nextcloud
  • or a custom name you recognize.

If you're unsure, open the default:

sudo nano /etc/nginx/sites-available/default

Or if you have a dedicated config:

sudo nano /etc/nginx/sites-available/omniversalmedia.org

2. Edit the file to include this block:

Inside the relevant server {} block (usually the one listening on port 80), add:

location /backend/ {
    proxy_pass http://127.0.0.1:8080/backend/;
    proxy_set_header Host $host;
    proxy_set_header X-Real-IP $remote_addr;
    proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-For $proxy_add_x_forwarded_for;
    proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-Proto $scheme;
}

Make sure this is inside the correct server {} block like this:

server {
    listen 80;
    server_name omniversalmedia.org;

    # other locations...

    location /backend/ {
        proxy_pass http://127.0.0.1:8080/backend/;
        proxy_set_header Host $host;
        proxy_set_header X-Real-IP $remote_addr;
        proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-For $proxy_add_x_forwarded_for;
        proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-Proto $scheme;
    }
}

3. Test and reload NGINX

sudo nginx -t

If syntax is OK:

sudo systemctl reload nginx

Youre Done

https://omniversalmedia.org/backend/

which NGINX will forward to your Apache server running Nextcloud on:

http://127.0.0.1:8080/backend/

Ah great catch.

The confusion comes from how the --password-from-env flag actually expects the environment variable OC_PASS to be defined in the same line as the occ command.

So instead of doing it in two steps (export + occ), you need to do it all in one command:

Use this format:

OC_PASS=ReturnOfTheFallen1337 sudo -u www-data php occ user:add --password-from-env hawk
OC_PASS=ReturnOfTheFallen1337 sudo -u www-data php occ user:add --password-from-env gina
OC_PASS=ReturnOfTheFallen1337 sudo -u www-data php occ user:add --password-from-env nightshade

Each line sets OC_PASS just for that command execution.

2025-05-30T05:59:29.457827Z assistant

Let's handle this in two parts:

1. Update PHP upload & memory limits for Nextcloud

The occ command itself cant directly change PHP limits (those are runtime configs), but heres what you do instead:

Edit your PHP config file

Depending on your distro and PHP version, edit this:

sudo nano /etc/php/8.1/fpm/php.ini

Or if youre using Apache:

sudo nano /etc/php/8.1/apache2/php.ini

Change these values:

upload_max_filesize = 4096M
post_max_size = 4096M
memory_limit = 4096M

You can go bigger if needed (e.g. 8192M).

Then restart your PHP server:

sudo systemctl restart php8.1-fpm

Or for Apache:

sudo systemctl restart apache2

Nextcloud will now honor those limits.

2. Point Nextcloud to use /mnt/ 12TB external storage

To check and mount it:

Check current mounts:

df -h
lsblk

Look for your 12TB volume, probably something like /dev/sdX1.

If its not mounted, mount it like this:

sudo mkdir /mnt/aethercore
sudo mount /dev/sdX1 /mnt/aethercore

Make sure permissions are correct:

sudo chown -R www-data:www-data /mnt/aethercore

Then, in Nextcloud, go to:

Settings External storage
Enable external storage (if not enabled under apps)
Add local storage, set it to /mnt/aethercore
Grant access to hawk, gina, nightshade, etc.

2025-05-30T06:01:41.083209Z user

And once more the file and directories you listed for the php.ini file does not exist - please give me an echo command or simply an occ commands that updates it via the nextcloud occ cli instead if it is an option

2025-05-30T06:01:41.704020Z assistant

Thanks for the clarification. Here's the truth:

The occ CLI does not allow setting PHP memory/upload limits directly because those are server-side PHP runtime settings, not Nextcloud app settings.

However heres what you can do in your case:

Step 1: Find the active PHP config path

Run:

php -i | grep "Loaded Configuration File"

Youll get something like:

Loaded Configuration File => /etc/php/8.2/cli/php.ini

You want to edit that file, or the equivalent for FPM or Apache.

Step 2: Use echo to append correct limits

If you know the file path (e.g. /etc/php/8.2/cli/php.ini), run:

sudo sed -i 's/^upload_max_filesize.*/upload_max_filesize = 4096M/' /etc/php/8.2/cli/php.ini
sudo sed -i 's/^post_max_size.*/post_max_size = 4096M/' /etc/php/8.2/cli/php.ini
sudo sed -i 's/^memory_limit.*/memory_limit = 4096M/' /etc/php/8.2/cli/php.ini

If the lines dont exist, you can append them:

echo "upload_max_filesize = 4096M" | sudo tee -a /etc/php/8.2/cli/php.ini
echo "post_max_size = 4096M"       | sudo tee -a /etc/php/8.2/cli/php.ini
echo "memory_limit = 4096M"        | sudo tee -a /etc/php/8.2/cli/php.ini

Then restart:

sudo systemctl restart php8.2-fpm

Or, if youre using php directly through Apache:

sudo systemctl restart apache2

Confirm changes worked:

php -i | grep -E "upload_max_filesize|post_max_size|memory_limit"

Why occ can't do it:

occ is run via PHP itself and inherits the currently active PHP memory limits. So if you're trying to fix memory issues or large uploads and can't edit PHP, occ wont help its already limited by the runtime.

Let me know the result of php -i | grep "Loaded Configuration File" and Ill tailor the exact commands for your system.

Perfect that clarifies a few things:

You're using PHP 8.3 CLI only, and PHP-FPM is not currently installed which explains the php8.3-fpm.service: Unit not found error.

To enable php.ini settings like upload size or memory limit for web requests via NGINX, you need PHP-FPM.

The CLI version (/etc/php/8.3/cli/php.ini) only affects terminal commands, not NGINX-served PHP like Nextcloud.

Heres how to fix it:

1. Install PHP-FPM 8.3

sudo apt update
sudo apt install php8.3-fpm

This will create:

  • /etc/php/8.3/fpm/php.ini
  • /run/php/php8.3-fpm.sock
  • The actual service: php8.3-fpm

2. Enable and Start PHP-FPM

sudo systemctl enable php8.3-fpm
sudo systemctl start php8.3-fpm

3. Restart PHP-FPM After Edits

After modifying /etc/php/8.3/fpm/php.ini, restart with:

sudo systemctl restart php8.3-fpm

4. Edit the FPM-Specific php.ini Instead

Once installed, use this file:

sudo nano /etc/php/8.3/fpm/php.ini

Update:

upload_max_filesize = 2G
post_max_size = 2G
memory_limit = 1024M

In your NGINX config (/etc/nginx/sites-available/nextcloud or your custom conf), make sure this section exists:

location ~ \.php$ {
    include snippets/fastcgi-php.conf;
    fastcgi_pass unix:/run/php/php8.3-fpm.sock;
}

Once done, restart NGINX:

sudo systemctl restart nginx

2025-05-30T06:12:44.167573Z user

What do i set post max to? 4096M ? Same for memory_limit?

2025-05-30T06:12:44.900160Z assistant

Heres a quick breakdown so you can choose wisely based on your system specs and intended use:

Recommended Upload Settings for Nextcloud (High-Capacity Server Use)

Directive Value Notes
upload_max_filesize 4G Max size of one file uploaded
post_max_size 4G (or 5G) Total size of all POST data in one request (must be upload_max_filesize)
memory_limit 2048M to 4096M Depends on how much RAM you can spare. Dont set higher than your real physical memory.

Example:

In /etc/php/8.3/fpm/php.ini (or /etc/php/8.3/cli/php.ini for CLI ops):

upload_max_filesize = 4G
post_max_size = 5G
memory_limit = 4096M

This supports 4GB uploads and leaves headroom for other form data or plugin processing.

After updating:

sudo systemctl restart php8.3-fpm
sudo systemctl restart nginx

Let me know your total RAM if you want a safer upper bound for memory_limit. 4G is fine for 8GB+ RAM systems.

2025-05-30T06:21:11.364080Z assistant

With your setup, you can safely configure generous limits for Nextclouds PHP settings. Heres a balanced recommendation:

Update these in /etc/php/8.3/cli/php.ini:

memory_limit = 4096M
upload_max_filesize = 4096M
post_max_size = 4096M
max_execution_time = 3600
max_input_time = 3600

Why these values?

  • memory_limit = 4096M: You have 32GB RAM, so allocating 4GB to PHP processes is safe.
  • upload_max_filesize & post_max_size: 4GB allows large file uploads (e.g. videos, archives).
  • Long max_execution_time and max_input_time: Helpful for Nextcloud processing large uploads, sync tasks, and OCC commands.

Once you've updated the file:

sudo systemctl restart php8.3-fpm  # If installed
sudo systemctl restart nginx

If php8.3-fpm isn't installed, and you're only using php via cli, restarting NGINX is still useful after editing php.ini.
